response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9‑inch round cake pans, then set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and 1 ½ teaspoons salt to ensure even distribution through the mixing process before adding wet.",
  "step2": "Combine wet ingredients in a separate bowl: beat 1 cup (240 ml) melted butter with 2 cups granulated sugar until light and fluffy, then add 4 large eggs one at a time, mixing well after each. Stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla extract for flavor depth and rich aroma to the batter overall.",
  "step3": "Gradually add the dry flour mixture to the wet butter‑sugar blend, stirring gently with a spatula until just combined. Fold in ¾ cup (180 ml) sour cream for moisture, then incorporate ½ cup (120 ml) whole milk, ensuring a smooth, glossy batter without overmixing or air bubbles that could spoil texture later.",
  "step4": "Prepare the chocolate ganache: melt 8 ounces (225 g) dark chocolate with ½ cup (120 ml) heavy cream over a double boiler, stirring constantly until silky. Add 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, a pinch of sea salt, and whisk until glossy, then let cool to a spreadable consistency that will coat the cake.",
  "step5": "Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges with a few moist crumbs. Remove cakes from oven, let them cool in pans for ten minutes, then transfer to a wire rack carefully.",
  "step6": "Place one cooled layer on a serving plate, spread half of the ganache evenly, then top with the second layer. Frost the entire cake with the remaining ganache, allowing it to drip down the sides for a rustic look. Chill briefly, slice, and serve to eight delighted guests with joy."
}
